TopicTitle: Procedural Parts Not Working - Need help!

Articles.Content:
I just installed the Procedural Parts mod for KSP 1.2.2, The parts show up, but when I place a fuel tank and right click it, the usual text box doesn't appear - At all, not even the stock fuel tank editor. If I place a Decoupler, it just brings up the normal settings for a decoupler.

Here's a screenshot of my folder:

Have I installed it wrong? Thanks for any suggestions.

Hello, and welcome to the forums! 

14 minutes ago, TheConfidentGamer said:

I just installed the Procedural Parts mod for KSP 1.2.2, The parts show up, but when I place a fuel tank and right click it, the usual text box doesn't appear - At all, not even the stock fuel tank editor. If I place a Decoupler, it just brings up the normal settings for a decoupler.

Here's a screenshot of my folder:

That looks like an old ModuleManager version, and a quick forum search makes me wonder if Procedural Parts really is available for 1.2.2.

Where exactly did you download the mod from?  Do you have a link?  (e.g. to a forum thread)

Is this where you got it?

...On the one hand, the title of that thread says "1.1.3", which would indicate it's obsolete.  On the other hand, I'm seeing lots of recent discussion in the thread that makes it appear that perhaps it's a going concern.

Perhaps you could ask your question there?

1 minute ago, Snark said:

Where exactly did you download the mod from?  Do you have a link?  (e.g. to a forum thread)

I got them from here. He has a link to GitHub, too.

Try this link ... This is the procedural parts mod that the BDAc Procedural Missiles is working with in KSP v1.2.2

 https://github.com/Swamp-Ig/ProceduralParts/releases
